pageProduct.name: Opti Gold Organic Infant Formula 900g
pageProduct.description:
General Information

Baby Formula

Warnings

Breast Milk Is Best For Babies. Before You Decide To Use This Product, Consult Your Doctor Or Healthcare Worker For Advice. To Supplement Only When Breast Milk Is Inadequate Or Unavailable For Babies 0-6 Months. Follow Instructions Exactly. Prepare Bottles And Teats As Directed. Do Not Change Proportions Of Powder Except On Medical Advice. Incorrect Preparation Can Make Your Baby Ill.

Common Uses

Baby Formula

Ingredients

Organic Lactose, Organic Vegetable Oil Blend (High Oleic Sunflower, Coconut, Soy, Canola), Organic Whole Milk Powder, Organic Whey Protein Concentrate, Organic Skim Milk Powder, Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA, from fish oil), Arachidonic Acid (ARA), Fructo-oligosaccharides (FOS), Lactobacillus Fermentum (CECT5716), Minerals (Di-Potassium Hydrogen Orthophosphate, Di-Calcium Hydrogen Orthophosphate, Magnesium Chloride, Sodium Chloride, Calcium Carbonate, Potassium Chloride, Ferrous Sulphate, Tri-Potassium Citrate, Tri-Sodium Citrate, Zinc Sulphate, Copper Sulphate, Manganese Sulphate, Potassium Iodide, Sodium Selenite), Emulsifier (Soy Lecithin), Vitamins (Sodium Ascorbate, Vitamin E Acetate, Vitamin A Acetate, Niacinamide, Calcium Pantothenate, Cholecalciferol, Thiamine Hydrochloride, Cyanocobalamin, Phytonadione, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Folic Acid, D-Biotin). CONTAINS MILK, SOY AND FISH.

Directions

1 scoop (equivalent to 8.5g) of powder added to 60ml of potable previously boiled lukewarm water. Each bottle should be prepared individually. This is a guide only. Your baby may need more or less than indicated. Ideally, formula should be prepared just prior to feeding. Otherwise, refrigerate prepared formula and use within 24 hours. 1.     Wash hands before preparing formula. Sterilise all utensils by boiling in water or using an approved steriliser. 2.     Boil drinking water and allow to cool until lukewarm. Measure the required amount of cooled, boiled water into sterilised feeding bottle. Warm to feeding temperature. 3.     Use only the enclosed scoop. Fill scoop lightly; level off using the built-in leveller. Do not compact the powder into the scoop. 4.     Add one level scoop of powder for each 60ml of water. Cap the bottle and shake briskly to dissolve the powder. 5.     Test temperature on wrist and feed immediately. Discard any unfinished formula. Prepare each bottle only as needed. It is safer to use immediately after preparation. Where made up formula is stored prior to use it must be refrigerated and if unused, discard within 24 hours.
